skill.name: security-management
skill.description: Manage security policies, firewall zones, access control rules (ACLs), and guest network access. Perform comprehensive security audits and compliance reviews.

skill.author: DataKnifeAI

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-only skill consisting of markdown documentation. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. The skill describes available UniFi Network MCP tools but does not implement them. Users interact with actual MCP tools provided by the UniFi Network MCP server.

content.value_statement: Managing network security policies across multiple firewall zones and access control rules is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill provides structured workflows to review firewall configurations, audit access control rules, manage guest network access, and generate security compliance reports for UniFi networks.
actual_capabilities: List and view firewall zones and network segmentation
Review and analyze access control rules (ACLs)
Monitor and manage guest network hotspot vouchers
Retrieve system information for compliance verification
Generate security audit reports with findings
Verify network segmentation and zone isolation policies
limitations: Requires UniFi Network MCP server with authentication configured
Provides read-only access for review and audit purposes
Cannot modify firewall rules or security configurations directly
Only supports UniFi Network devices and infrastructure

use_cases.title: Quarterly Security Audits
use_cases.description: Systematically review firewall zones and ACLs to verify network segmentation meets security policies.

use_cases.title: Compliance Verification
use_cases.description: Generate security reports to demonstrate compliance with internal policies or regulatory requirements.

use_cases.title: Multi-Site Security Review
use_cases.description: Efficiently audit security configurations across multiple client UniFi deployments.

prompt_templates.title: List Firewall Zones
prompt_templates.prompt: Show all firewall zones and their configuration including which networks belong to each zone.

prompt_templates.title: Review ACL Rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Review all access control rules and explain what each rule controls and why it exists.

prompt_templates.title: Check Guest Vouchers
prompt_templates.prompt: List all active guest network vouchers with their status, expiration dates, and usage limits.

prompt_templates.title: Full Security Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete security audit of the UniFi network including firewall zones, ACL rules, guest access policies, and any potential security concerns.

output_examples.input: Show all firewall zones and their configuration
output: ‚Ä¢ LAN Zone: Internal network with full access to trusted services
‚Ä¢ GUEST Zone: Isolated network with internet-only access, blocked from LAN
‚Ä¢ IOT Zone: Isolated network for smart devices, limited local access
‚Ä¢ DMZ Zone: Demilitarized zone for servers requiring external access

best_practices: Review firewall zones quarterly to ensure segmentation matches current network topology and trust levels.
Document all access control rules with business justification to support compliance audits and onboarding.
Use the security audit workflow systematically before deploying new network segments or services.
anti_patterns: Leaving default firewall rules without reviewing if they match current security policies.
Creating overly permissive ACLs without documenting the business requirement for each rule.
Neglecting to review expired or unused guest vouchers that may still have active network access.

faq.question: Which UniFi devices are supported?
faq.answer: Works with UniFi Gateways, USG, UDR, UDM-Pro, and other UniFi console devices running UniFi Network OS.

faq.question: What are the rate limits?
faq.answer: Rate limits depend on the UniFi Network API. The skill makes standard API calls and respects controller limits.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing tools?
faq.answer: This skill works with any Claude or Codex instance that has the UniFi Network MCP server configured and authenticated.

faq.question: Is my network data safe?
faq.answer: The skill only reads data through the UniFi API. No data is stored or transmitted beyond the authenticated session.

faq.question: Why is my audit returning empty results?
faq.answer: Ensure the UniFi controller is accessible and credentials have read permissions for network, firewall, and hotspot resources.

faq.question: How is this different from the UniFi controller?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-assisted analysis and standardized reporting rather than manual point-and-click configuration through the controller UI.
